title: How to Do Haldi Kumkum

steps.headline: Place haldi (turmeric) and kumkum (vermillion) into two small bowls (usually special ones are available for this, but you don't need to have special ones).
steps.description: Also add flowers, betel nut leaves, betel nut and  coconut (one per female). In addition, you may also choose to give bangles, sweets, small novelties and money or gifts.

steps.headline: On one plate or a serving tray (metal is better), place the haldi/kumkum at the top.
steps.description: Place money, coconut and betel nut on the betel nut leaves. Bangles can also be placed with the coconut.

steps.headline: Offer haldi/kumkum to married women and unmarried women.
steps.description: A married woman would take the haldi, but an unmarried woman will only  take the kumkum. Note: In some customs, haldi/kumkum can be placed on the woman by the person offering it.

steps.headline: Pick up the flower and give it to the woman.
steps.description: She should accept the flower with both hands extended and should wear the flower in her hair.

steps.headline: Pick up the coconut with the betel nut leaf, nut and money and offer these to the woman.
steps.description: The woman should accept the coconut by holding out both of her hands. If there are more things to be offered, they can be offered now.

steps.headline: If the person receiving the haldi kumkum is older, do namaskar to the person to receive blessing.
Repeat as needed.
steps.description: You can now repeat the process with the next person.
